h1.span: STATUS UPDATES: Coronavirus Impacts on Brunswick County Schools

div.div: Governor Cooper issued a Stay at Home Order effective Monday, March 30th at 5pm. With the exception of the 3 high school cafeterias serving the student meal pickup services, all Brunswick County Schools buildings will be closed while the Stay at Home Order is in effect. School Buildings will be closed to students until at least May 15th. Please scroll down for numerous resources to help students and parents as we continue to adjust to the impacts of the Coronavirus.

El gobernador Cooper emiti una orden de quedarse en casa para todo el estado, a partir de las 5 p.m. del lunes. Continuaremos operando nuestros servicios de comidas para estudiantes en las tres ubicaciones de la escuela secundaria de 11 a.m. a 1 p.m. para que todos los estudiantes recojan el almuerzo y el desayuno.Desplcese hacia abajo para obtener numerosos recursos para ayudar a los estudiantes y padres a medida que continuamos ajustndonos a los impactos del Coronavirus.

MEAL PICKUPS: The three High Schools continue to provide drive thru meal pickup from 11am to 1pm, Monday through Friday, and the Transportation Department will continue to serve meals to homes that are on their route. No reservation needed. Please pull up and let the staff know how many student meals you need. If you currently receivemeals or recently requested them from an alternate location, you need to login to the Bus Transportation Websiteon Saturday or Sundayto check for bus stop timesfor the following week.

li.a: Click here for Frequently Asked Questions about the Student Meals Services and Online Form.
Click here to check bus route times for families who have requested delivery.

div.div: DIRECTIONS FOR PREORDER: Orders placed by Wednesday deadline each weekwill be added to the bus stop routes for thefollowing week.

ol.li: First, go tohttps://bcschildnutrition.com/andfill out the online form (name, address, email, meal count)

Second, the following weekend check the bus route and info link(https://bit.ly/BCSBusRoutesNewLocationsorhttp://media.bcswan.net/liveweb/webquery/) to see where and when to expect your delivery. Thursday, the Transportation Department begins putting together next week's bus stop times and locations for everyone who signed up this week by the Wednesday deadline. It will take a couple days to coordinate the routes.

div.p: DO THIS: On Saturday or Sunday, everyone who preordered meals online will need to put their address into the bus route information link (found here:https://bit.ly/BCSBusRoutesNewLocationsorhttp://media.bcswan.net/liveweb/webquery/) to get the updated times and locations for pickup for next week.

Please wait until the weekend to check for times and locations for next week.
Example: If you signed up on Tuesday, you will need to check the website on Saturday or Sunday for the updated routes.

p.a: Click HERE for FAQ about the Student Meals Services and Online Form.
Click HERE to watch a short video on the online preorder process.

div.div: Remember, you must place your order by Wednesday to receive your meals the following week.This allows our Transportation Department enough time to create the safest routes and times for pickup/dropoff.

Parents who can not travel to a food distribution site at one of our high schools and do not have access to internet should contact their child's school and leave a detailed message with their needs. There is no staff at the school but we will be checking voicemails to gather information from students and parents.

Breakfast and lunch pickup meals are always available Monday through Friday for all students from 11am to 1pm at the three high school campuses. There is no charge for this service. Multiple meals may be picked up by parents and caregivers. Recipients should be prepared to drive-up or walk up to the designated area and let the staff know how many meals are needed. Please eat perishable food within' two hours of pickup. Milk should be consumed or refrigerated immediately.

div.p:
NBHS:114 Scorpion Drive Leland, NC 28451
WBHS:550 Whiteville Road Shallotte, NC 28470
SBHS:280 Cougar Drive, BSL Southport, NC 28461

div.div: RECOGIDAS DE COMIDA:Desayuno y almuerzo estn ahora disponibles para recoger de Lunes a Viernes para todos los estudiantes de 11 am a 1 pm en las tres instalaciones de escuela superior. No habr cargo por este servicio.Los padres que no pueden viajar a un sitio de distribucin de alimentos en una de nuestras escuelas secundarias deben comunicarse con la escuela de sus hijos y dejar un mensaje detallado con sus necesidades. No hay personal en la escuela pero revisaremos los mensajes de voz.Los padres y cuidadores pueden recoger varias comidas. Los destinatarios deben estar preparados para conducir o caminar hasta el rea designada y dejar que el personal sepa cuntas comidas se necesitan. Coma alimentos perecederos dentro de las dos horas posteriores a la recoleccin. La leche debe consumirse o refrigerarse de inmediato.

div.p: Direcciones para pre ordenar: Los pedidos realizados antes de la fecha lmite del mircoles cada semana se agregarn a las rutas de la parada de autobs para la semana siguiente.

Primero, vaya ahttps://bcschildnutrition.com/y complete la forma en lnea (nombre, direccin, correo electrnico, cantidad de comidas).
Segundo, la siguiente semana verifique la ruta del autobs en el enlacehttps://bit.ly/BCSBusRoutesNewLocationsohttp://media.bcswan.net/liveweb/webquery/) para ver cuando y donde esperar su entrega.

Recuerde, usted debe hacer su orden el Mircoles para recibir sus comidas la siguiente semana. Esto permite que nuestro Departamento de Transportacin tenga suficiente tiempo para crear el itinerario y rutas ms seguras para entrega/recogido.

Localizaciones de recogido en Escuela Superior. No se proveer espacio para comer en el lugar de recogido de comidas de las tres escuelas superiores. Mltiples comidas pueden ser recogidas por los padres o encargados.
Los que reciben deben estar preparados a caminar o conducir hasta el rea designada y permitir que el equipo de trabajo sepa cuntas comidas se necesitan. Favor de consumir los alimentos perecederos dentro de dos horas del recogido. La leche debe ser consumida o refrigerada inmediatamente. Las localizaciones estn a continuacin:
NBHS: 114 Scorpion Drive Leland, NC 28451
WBHS: 550 Whiteville Road Shallotte, NC 2847
SBHS: 280 Cougar Drive, BSL Southport, NC 28461

div.strong: MATTHEW'S MINISTRY BACKPACK FEEDING PROGRAM SCHEDULE FOR 4/22 through 4/24:
div.p:
Matthew's Ministry, the organization that distributes food for children at schools on Fridays for the weekend, has 3 pickupdays planned this week for students who are a part of the Backpack Program. "Bags of food will be available at these locations for families to drive up and pick up their childrens food .
We are asking families to pick one site (each week) that works best for their schedule and location. A bag of food will be given for each child in the family." -Matthew's Ministry
If you would like to donate to the non-profit, please email the organization atmatthewsministry@gmail.com

p.em: El Ministerio de Mateo ( Matthews Ministry), la organizacin que distribuye alimentos para nios en las escuelas los viernes para el fin de semana, tiene planificados 3 das esta semana de recoleccin para los estudiantes que forman parte del Programa de Mochilas.

p.br:
4 PM - 6 PM - Beach Road Baptist Church - 4457 Flagship Avenue, Southport, NC 28461
Thursday 4/23
1 PM - 3 PM - Seaside United Methodist Church - 1300 Seaside Rd., Sunset Beach, NC 28468
Friday 4/24
10 AM - 12 PM - Town Creek Baptist Church - 832 Green Hill Rd., Leland, NC 28451;
4 PM - 5 PM- The Leland Church (TLC)- 1107 Newpointe Blvd. Suite 24, Leland, NC 28451
4 PM - 6 PM - Generations Church - 4019 Executive Park Blvd., Southport, NC 28461;

div.p:
Matthews Ministry backpack food bags can also be picked up at Brunswick
Family Assistance (appointment only):
Shallotte Office - 4600-10 - Main Street - 910-754-4766
Leland Office - 324-1 Village Road - 910-408-1700

p.strong: WINGS MINISTRY BACKPACKS FULL OF BLESSINGS PROGRAM:

div.div: WINGS Ministry, which provides weekend meals to BCS students through their Backpacks Full Of Blessings Program,will continue to fulfill the needs of the students that are enrolled in the program on a per request basis. If you have a student who is enrolled in our program, you may contact WINGS Ministry at: 910-512-7643 email:wingsministriesbc@gmail.com

div.strong: WINGS MINISTRY MOCHILAS PROGRAMA COMPLETO DE BENDICIONES:

div.div: El Ministerio WINGS, que proporciona comidas de fin de semana a los estudiantes de BCS a travs de su programa Mochilas llenas de bendiciones, continuar satisfaciendo las necesidades de los estudiantes que estn inscritos en el programa por solicitud. Si tiene un estudiante inscrito en nuestro programa, puede comunicarse con el Ministerio WINGS al: 910-512-7643email:wingsministriesbc@gmail.com

STAFF:We know there will be many questions, please be patient as we work to clarify the details of an evolving situation.Please check work emails for information on emergency paid leave and instruction for employees. Your immediate supervisor can help with opportunities to work from home as well.

SENIORS, GRADUATION, SPRING BREAK: We know that this an especially stressful time for our Senior Students. In this video, Superintendent Dr. Oates answers several questionsinvolving our Class of 2020, including how they will be graded this year, Graduation(and possibly Prom), and Spring Break for everyone.
Click HERE to view the video message from Dr. Oates

COPING WITH CORONAVIRUS IMPACTS:Brunswick County SchoolsBehavioral Specialist Tracy Jones has a special message for children. She, along with a puppet that connects with kids, talk about the Coronavirus and ways that we can cope with it right now, together.

div.p: STUDENT SUPPORT SERVICES:BCS Student Support Serviceshas numerous resources to help students and parents during this challenging time we are all going through.Behavior Specialists, School Counselors, School Psychologist, School Social Workers, and Dropout Prevention Specialists are all available to talk with to support the social-emotional learning and mental health needs during this unprecedented time.

SERVICIOS DE APOYO ESTUDIANTIL:BCS Student Support Servicestiene numerosos recursos para ayudar a los estudiantes y a los padres durante este momento difcil por el que todos estamos pasando. Los especialistas en comportamiento, los consejeros escolares, el psiclogo escolar, los trabajadores sociales escolares y los especialistas en prevencin de abandono escolar estn disponibles para hablar con el fin de apoyar el aprendizaje social-emocional y las necesidades de salud mental durante este tiempo sin precedentes.
HELPFUL LINKS:This link takes you directly to websites related to COVID 19/Coronavirus impacts for Brunswick County Schools, Local/State/Federal Coronavirus.
ENLACES TILES:Este enlace lo lleva directamente a sitios web relacionados con los impactos de COVID 19 / Coronavirus para las Escuelas del Condado de Brunswick, Coronavirus Local / Estatal / Federal.
div.div: INTERACTIVE MAP:You can enter your address on this webpage and it will provide you with what services/offers are available to you. Puede ingresar su direccin en esta pgina web y le proporcionar qu servicios / ofertas estn disponibles para usted.

div.p:
TALKING WITH CHILDREN:Adults play an extremely important role in helping children cope with the unknown.
This is one of those times. Here is some helpful advice from the experts:

ol.li: Be calm and reassuring.
Listen and let kids ask questions.
Avoid language that blames others.
Limit screen time on COVID-19.
Provide honest, age-appropriate info.
Teach actions to reduce spread of germs.

div.p:
Bonus: Be their strength. They need it.
You can find more helpful information on talking with children on the CDC's website via this link:https://bit.ly/TalkingWithKidsAboutCoronavirus

HABLANDO CON NIOS:los adultos juegan un papel extremadamente importante para ayudar a los nios a hacer frente a lo desconocido.
Este es uno de esos momentos. Aqu hay algunos consejos tiles de los expertos:

ol.li: Mantn la calma
Escucha
Evita el lenguaje que culpe a los dems.
Limite el tiempo de pantalla en COVID-19.
Proporcione informacin honesta y apropiada para su edad.
Ensear acciones para reducir la propagacin de grmenes.

div.div:
CRISIS CHAT LINE:ACrisis CHATline courtesy of Integrated Family Services, PLLC is available for all staff, students, parents, family, and friends that will offer online emotional support 24 hours a day. Trained chat specialists are available to assist individuals who are depressed, going through a hard time, need to talk, or having
thoughts of hurting themselves. Any life issues may be discussed utilizing the Crisis CHAT line. The goal of Integrated Family
Services Crisis CHAT line is to help you and others reduce stress and feel empowered to make healthy decisions. To utilize this free
service, simply go towww.integratedfamilyservices.netand click the chat with us icon at the top of the page.
You can also callMobile Crisis Hotline 1-866-437-1821

LNEA DE CHAT DE CRISIS: Una lnea de Crisis CHAT est disponible para todo el personal, estudiantes, padres, familiares y amigos que ofrecer apoyo emocional en lnea las 24 horas del da. Especialistas capacitados en chat estn disponibles para ayudar a las personas que estn deprimidas, pasando por un momento difcil, necesitan hablar o tener
pensamientos de hacerse dao a s mismos. Cualquier problema de la vida puede discutirse utilizando la lnea Crisis CHAT. El objetivo de la familia integrada
La lnea CHAT de Crisis de Servicios es para ayudarlo a usted y a otros a reducir el estrs y sentirse empoderados para tomar decisiones saludables. Para utilizar esto gratis
servicio, simplemente vaya awww.integratedfamilyservices.nety haga clic en el icono "chatear con nosotros" en la parte superior de la pgina. Tambin puede llamar a la lnea directa de crisis mvil 1-866-437-1821

TECH SUPPORT:Parents and Students, if you are having issues with technology that you checked out from school(Chromebook, laptops, tablets, etc), please contact BCS Technology Support before calling the individual school. You can reach Tech Support by calling910-253-1095 or emailhelpdesk@bcswan.net
They should be able to help fix the problem.
You can also find Brunswick County Schools Troubleshooting Tech Tips here:http://bit.ly/BCSAtHomeAccessTroubleshooting

div.strong: 3/26/2020: In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until May 15th, 2020.

div.div: Governor Cooper issued a Stay at Home Order effective Monday, March 30th at 5pm or sooner if possible. With the exception of the 3 high school cafeterias, all Brunswick County Schools buildings will be closed as of Monday morning until further notice.

El gobernador Cooper emiti una orden de quedarse en casa para todo el estado, a partir de las 5 p.m. del lunes. Continuaremos operando nuestros servicios de comidas para estudiantes en las tres ubicaciones de la escuela secundaria de 11 a.m. a 1 p.m. para que todos los estudiantes recojan el almuerzo y el desayuno.

STAFF:We know there will be many questions, please be patient as we work to clarify the details of an evolving situation. As of right now:
Only essential personnel who are involved in the student meal services currently being offered will report to work until further notice. We will continue to offer meals to students as it is considered essential and allowed under this Order.
Staff who have been teleworking are encouraged to continue their work from home during this time.
Information on emergency paid leave and instruction for employees will be communicated to you in the coming days.

MEAL PICKUPS:Meal pickup services continue for all students at the high schools. Breakfast and lunch pickup meals are now available Monday through Friday for all students from 11am to 1pm at the three high school campuses. There is no charge for this service.

RECOGIDAS DE COMIDA:Desayuno y almuerzo estn ahora disponibles para recoger de Lunes a Viernes para todos los estudiantes de 11 am a 1 pm en las tres instalaciones de escuela superior. No habr cargo por este servicio.

p.strong:
DAILY PICKUP SITES FOR ALL STUDENTS:
SITIOS DE RECOGIDA DIARIOS PARA TODOS LOS ESTUDIANTES:

div.div: NBHS:114 Scorpion Drive Leland, NC 28451
WBHS:550 Whiteville Road Shallotte, NC 28470
SBHS:280 Cougar Drive, BSL Southport, NC 28461

div.strong: MATTHEW'S MINISTRY BACKPACK FEEDING PROGRAM SCHEDULE FOR 4/1-4/3:
div.p:
Matthew's Ministry, the organization that distributes food for children at schools on Fridays for the weekend, has 3 pickupdays planned this week for students who are a part of the Backpack Program. We are asking families to pick one site (each week) that works best for their schedule and location. A bag of food will be given for each child in the family." -Matthew's Ministry

div.div:
Wednesday 4/1
4 PM - 6 PM - Beach Road Baptist Church - 4457 Flagship Avenue, Southport, NC 28461
4 PM - 6 PM - New Creations Worship Center - 3127 George II Highway, Southport, NC 28461
4 PM - 6 PM - PC3 Leland - 1018 E. Grandiflora Dr. Suite E, Leland, NC 28451
4 PM - 6 PM - Camp United Methodist Church - 4807 Main St., Shallotte, NC 28470
Thursday 4/2
1 PM - 3 PM - Seaside United Methodist Church - 1300 Seaside Rd., Sunset Beach, NC
28468
4 PM - 6 PM - Trinity United Methodist Church- 209 East Nash Street, Southport, NC 28461
Friday 4/3
10 AM - 12 PM - Town Creek Baptist Church - 832 Green Hill Rd., Leland, NC 28451
4 PM - 6 PM - Generations Church - 4019 Executive Park Blvd., Southport, NC 28461

div.strong: 3/26/2020: In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until May 15th, 2020.

div.div: Per Governor Cooper, all public schools will be closed to students as instructional settings through May 15, 2020.
Todas las escuelas pblicas estarn cerradas para los estudiantes hasta el 15 de mayo de 2020.Las actualizaciones en espaol siguen a las actualizaciones en ingls.

div.p: STUDENT SUPPORT SERVICES:BCS Student Support Services has numerous resources to help students and parents during this challenging time we are all going through.Behavior Specialists, School Counselors, School Psychologist, School Social Workers, and Dropout Prevention Specialists are all available to talk with to support the social-emotional learning and mental health needs during this unprecedented time.

SERVICIOS DE APOYO ESTUDIANTIL:BCS Student Support Services tiene numerosos recursos para ayudar a los estudiantes y a los padres durante este momento difcil por el que todos estamos pasando. Los especialistas en comportamiento, los consejeros escolares, el psiclogo escolar, los trabajadores sociales escolares y los especialistas en prevencin de abandono escolar estn disponibles para hablar con el fin de apoyar el aprendizaje social-emocional y las necesidades de salud mental durante este tiempo sin precedentes.
HELPFUL LINKS:This link takes you directly to websites related to COVID 19/Coronavirus impacts for Brunswick County Schools, Local/State/Federal Coronavirus.

ENLACES TILES: Este enlace lo lleva directamente a sitios web relacionados con los impactos de COVID 19 / Coronavirus para las Escuelas del Condado de Brunswick, Coronavirus Local / Estatal / Federal.
div.div: INTERACTIVE MAP: You can enter your address on this webpage and it will provide you with what services/offers are available to you. Puede ingresar su direccin en esta pgina web y le proporcionar qu servicios / ofertas estn disponibles para usted.

div.p:
TALKING WITH CHILDREN: Adults play an extremely important role in helping children cope with the unknown.
This is one of those times. Here is some helpful advice from the experts:

ol.li: Be calm and reassuring.
Listen and let kids ask questions.
Avoid language that blames others.
Limit screen time on COVID-19.
Provide honest, age-appropriate info.
Teach actions to reduce spread of germs.

div.p:
Bonus: Be their strength. They need it.
You can find more helpful information on talking with children on the CDC's website via this link:https://bit.ly/TalkingWithKidsAboutCoronavirus

HABLANDO CON NIOS: los adultos juegan un papel extremadamente importante para ayudar a los nios a hacer frente a lo desconocido.
Este es uno de esos momentos. Aqu hay algunos consejos tiles de los expertos:

ol.li: Mantn la calma
Escucha
Evita el lenguaje que culpe a los dems.
Limite el tiempo de pantalla en COVID-19.
Proporcione informacin honesta y apropiada para su edad.
Ensear acciones para reducir la propagacin de grmenes.

div.div:
CRISIS CHAT LINE: ACrisis CHATline courtesy of Integrated Family Services, PLLC is available for all staff, students, parents, family, and friends that will offer online emotional support 24 hours a day. Trained chat specialists are available to assist individuals who are depressed, going through a hard time, need to talk, or having
thoughts of hurting themselves. Any life issues may be discussed utilizing the Crisis CHAT line. The goal of Integrated Family
Services Crisis CHAT line is to help you and others reduce stress and feel empowered to make healthy decisions. To utilize this free
service, simply go to www.integratedfamilyservices.net and click the chat with us icon at the top of the page.
You can also callMobile Crisis Hotline 1-866-437-1821

LNEA DE CHAT DE CRISIS: Una lnea de Crisis CHAT est disponible para todo el personal, estudiantes, padres, familiares y amigos que ofrecer apoyo emocional en lnea las 24 horas del da. Especialistas capacitados en chat estn disponibles para ayudar a las personas que estn deprimidas, pasando por un momento difcil, necesitan hablar o tener
pensamientos de hacerse dao a s mismos. Cualquier problema de la vida puede discutirse utilizando la lnea Crisis CHAT. El objetivo de la familia integrada
La lnea CHAT de Crisis de Servicios es para ayudarlo a usted y a otros a reducir el estrs y sentirse empoderados para tomar decisiones saludables. Para utilizar esto gratis
servicio, simplemente vaya a www.integratedfamilyservices.net y haga clic en el icono "chatear con nosotros" en la parte superior de la pgina. Tambin puede llamar a la lnea directa de crisis mvil 1-866-437-1821

TECH SUPPORT:Parents and Students, if you are having issues with technology that you checked out from school(Chromebook, laptops, tablets, etc), please contact BCS Technology Support before calling the individual school. You can reach Tech Support by calling910-253-1095 or email helpdesk@bcswan.net
They should be able to help fix the problem.
You can also find Brunswick County Schools Troubleshooting Tech Tips here:http://bit.ly/BCSAtHomeAccessTroubleshooting
STAFF:Right now we are operating as optional work days for staff while closed to in-person teaching for students. Please see supervisor for additional information on work opportunities.

PERSONAL: En este momento estamos operando como das de trabajo opcionales para el personal mientras estamos cerrados a la enseanza en persona para los estudiantes. Consulte al supervisor para obtener informacin adicional sobre oportunidades de trabajo.

MEAL PICKUPS:Meal pickup services continue for all students at the high schools. Breakfast and lunch pickup meals are now available Monday through Friday for all students from 11am to 1pm at the three high school campuses. There is no charge for this service. Parents who can not travel to a food distribution site at one of our high schools should contact their child's school between 9am and 2pm so that we can gather information on the needs.Please eat perishable food within' two hours of pickup. Milk should be consumed or refrigerated immediately.

RECOGIDAS DE COMIDA:Desayuno y almuerzo estn ahora disponibles para recoger de Lunes a Viernes para todos los estudiantes de 11 am a 1 pm en las tres instalaciones de escuela superior. No habr cargo por este servicio. Los padres que no puedan viajar hasta los centros de distribucin deben comunicarse con la escuela de su nio entre 9 am y 2 pm para recopilar informacin para lo que puedan necesitar.Los servicios de recoleccin de comidas continan para todos los estudiantes en las escuelas secundarias. Coma alimentos perecederos dentro de las dos horas posteriores a la recoleccin. La leche debe consumirse o refrigerarse de inmediato.

p.strong: DAILY PICKUP SITES FOR ALL STUDENTS:

div.p: Breakfast and lunch pickup meals are now available Monday through Friday for all students from 11am to 1pm at the three high school campuses. There is no charge for this service. Parents who can not travel to a food distribution site at one of our high schools should contact their child's school between 9am and 2pm so that we can gather information on the needs.
div.div: NBHS:114 Scorpion Drive Leland, NC 28451
WBHS:550 Whiteville Road Shallotte, NC 28470
SBHS:280 Cougar Drive, BSL Southport, NC 28461

span.span: SITIOS DE RECOGIDA DIARIOS PARA TODOS LOS ESTUDIANTES:

div.p: Desayuno y almuerzo estn ahora disponibles para recoger de Lunes a Viernes para todos los estudiantes de 11 am a 1 pm en las tres instalaciones de escuela superior. No habr cargo por este servicio. Los padres que no puedan viajar hasta los centros de distribucin deben comunicarse con la escuela de su nio entre 9 am y 2 pm para recopilar informacin para lo que puedan necesitar.

Matthew's Ministry, the organization that distributes food for children at schools on Fridays for the weekend, has 3 pickupdays planned this week for students who are a part of the Backpack Program. "Bags of food will be available at these locations for families to drive up and pick up their childrens food .
We are asking families to pick one site (each week) that works best for their schedule and location. A bag of food will be given for each child in the family." -Matthew's Ministry
If you would like to donate to the non-profit, please email the organization atmatthewsministry@gmail.com

p.em: El Ministerio de Mateo ( Matthews Ministry), la organizacin que distribuye alimentos para nios en las escuelas los viernes para el fin de semana, tiene planificados 3 das esta semana de recoleccin para los estudiantes que forman parte del Programa de Mochilas. Visite www.bcswan.net y haga clic en 'Localidades de recoleccin de alimentos para estudiantes 'en la pgina principal de www.bcswan.net. Esta pgina se actualizar cada semana con nuevas localidades. Tambin puede recoger comidas para todos los estudiantes de lunes a viernes, de 11 a.m. a 1 p.m., en los tres recintos de la escuela secundaria

p.strong: SITIOS DE DISTRIBUCIN para 25/3 - 27/03 para el programa de mochila:
WINGS MINISTRY BACKPACKS FULL OF BLESSINGS PROGRAM:

div.div: WINGS Ministry, which provides weekend meals to BCS students through their Backpacks Full Of Blessings Program,will continue to fulfill the needs of the students that are enrolled in the program on a per request basis. If you have a student who is enrolled in our program, you may contact WINGS Ministry at: 910-512-7643 email:wingsministriesbc@gmail.com

div.strong: WINGS MINISTRY MOCHILAS PROGRAMA COMPLETO DE BENDICIONES:

div.div: El Ministerio WINGS, que proporciona comidas de fin de semana a los estudiantes de BCS a travs de su programa Mochilas llenas de bendiciones, continuar satisfaciendo las necesidades de los estudiantes que estn inscritos en el programa por solicitud. Si tiene un estudiante inscrito en nuestro programa, puede comunicarse con el Ministerio WINGS al: 910-512-7643email:wingsministriesbc@gmail.com

div.strong: 3/24/2020: In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until May 15th, 2020.

div.div: Per Governor Cooper, all public schools will be closed to students as instructional settings through May 15, 2020.
Todas las escuelas pblicas estarn cerradas para los estudiantes hasta el 15 de mayo de 2020.

SPECIAL MESSAGE: There are so many members of the BCS Family stepping outside of their comfort zone to help us all get through these challenging times together right now. Students, Parents, Staff, the Community. We are all in this together.

li.a: Superintendent Dr. Jerry L. Oates and School Board Chair Ellen Milligan share a special message of appreciation and commitment for us all in a video you can view by clicking HERE.

span.strong: 3/20/2020: In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until March 30th, 2020.

div.div: BCS Family, here is the Friday update from Brunswick County Schools. School are closed as instructional settingsuntil March 30th per Governor Cooper and will be optional work days for staff.Las escuelas estn cerradas como entornos de instruccin hasta el 30 de marzo por Governor Cooper y sern das de trabajo opcionales para el personal.

The Board of Education approved a resolution to give Superintendent Dr. Oates the ability to make changes that are related to the impacts of the Coronavirus without having to call an additional emergency meeting with Board Members.

li.a: Click HERE for a copy of the resolution

div.div: Superintendent Dr. Oates also took a moment to read one of his favorite books to students at home.

li.a: Click HERE to watch the video.

div.p:

div.strong: 3/18/2020: In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until March 30th, 2020.

div.div: BCS Family, here is the Thursday update from Brunswick County Schools. School are closed as instructional settingsuntil March 30th per Governor Cooper and will be optional work days for staff.

The Board of Education has called an emergency meeting to be held on Friday, March 20th for the purpose of discussing a Resolution to Grant Emergency Powers to the Superintendent. The meeting will begin at 10:00 a.m., and will be held in the Boardroom of the Brunswick County Schools Administrative Offices located at 35 Referendum Drive, Bolivia, NC. Due to the current recommendations from the Center for Disease Control to slow the spread of Covid-19, there will be limited seating available in order to comply with the recommendation for social distancing. The public is encouraged to join the meeting via Livestream. Here is the direct link that will go live shortly before the meeting.
Shoutout to the Child Nutrition Department! Through Thursday, the Child Nutrition Department has served nearly 6,500 meals to students at the three high school meal pickup locations.

Un saludo al Departamento de Nutricin Infantil! Hasta el jueves, el Departamento de Nutricin Infantil ha servido casi 6,500 comidas a los estudiantes en los tres lugares de recoleccin de comida de la escuela secundaria.

span.strong: 3/18/2020: In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until March 30th, 2020.

div.div: BCS Family, here is the Wednesday update from Brunswick County Schools. Schools are of course closed as instructional settings until March 30th per Governor Cooper/this week is optional work days for staff.

Earlier this week we told you about the online educational resources to keep students engaged during this downtime. Our instructional technology crew has put together some very helpful troubleshooting tips if you are having issues accessing them and will continue to update the page as necessary.

li.a: Click HERE for Troubleshooting tips for at-home access/devices.
Click HERE for Online Educational Resources/Video Tutorials

div.div: Have you checked out the Facebook page of your child's school? Many of them have wonderful ideas to keep the kids engaged in an educational format while at home. We've even seen an assistant principal reading to students via youtube and numerous livestreaming activities from around the country.

Meal pickup services continue for all students at the high schools. Breakfast and lunch pickup meals are now available Monday through Friday for all students from 11am to 1pm at the three high school campuses. There is no charge for this service. Parents who can not travel to a food distribution site at one of our high schools should contact their child's school between 9am and 2pm so that we can gather information on the needs.Please eat perishable food within' two hours of pickup. Milk should be consumed or refrigerated immediately.

Desayuno y almuerzo estn ahora disponibles para recoger de Lunes a Viernes para todos los estudiantes de 11 am a 1 pm en las tres instalaciones de escuela superior. No habr cargo por este servicio. Los padres que no puedan viajar hasta los centros de distribucin deben comunicarse con la escuela de su nio entre 9 am y 2 pm para recopilar informacin para lo que puedan necesitar.Los servicios de recoleccin de comidas continan para todos los estudiantes en las escuelas secundarias. Coma alimentos perecederos dentro de las dos horas posteriores a la recoleccin. La leche debe consumirse o refrigerarse de inmediato.

div.div: We put together a comprehensive list of Frequently Asked Questions regarding school closings as related to Coronavirus impacts. Please click HERE to read the questions and the answers directly from the NC Department of Public Instruction.

That's it for today, please be kind and caring to everyone in this challenging time. If there is an issue with an online resource, we're on it. Everything happening right now is a developing situation, and Brunswick County Schools is on it. We are all in it together and will adapt together.Next update is 3/19/2020

span.strong: 3/17/2020 UPDATE: In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until March 30th, 2020.

span.span: BCS Family, here is the Tuesday update from Brunswick County Schools.The governor has ordered all schools closed until March 30th. This weekwill be optional work days for staff. This is an ever-evolving time and we are dedicated to getting through this together.

THURSDAY 3/19:

em.span: DAILY PICKUP SITES FOR ALL STUDENTS:

div.p: Breakfast and lunch pickup meals are now available Monday through Friday for all students from 11am to 1pm at the three high school campuses. There is no charge for this service. Parents who can not travel to a food distribution site at one of our high schools should contact their child's school between 9am and 2pm so that we can gather information on the needs.
div.div: NBHS:114 Scorpion Drive Leland, NC 28451
WBHS:550 Whiteville Road Shallotte, NC 28470
SBHS:280 Cougar Drive, BSL Southport, NC 28461
div.p: Desayuno y almuerzo estn ahora disponibles para recoger de Lunes a Viernes para todos los estudiantes de 11 am a 1 pm en las tres instalaciones de escuela superior. No habr cargo por este servicio. Los padres que no puedan viajar hasta los centros de distribucin deben comunicarse con la escuela de su nio entre 9 am y 2 pm para recopilar informacin para lo que puedan necesitar.

ul.li: We put together a comprehensive list of Frequently Asked Questions regarding school closings as related to Coronavirus impacts. Please click HERE to read the questions and the answers directly from the NC Department of Public Instruction.

span.strong: 3/16/2020 UPDATE:In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until March 30th, 2020.

div.div:
BCS Family, here is the Monday update from Brunswick County Schools. The governor has ordered all schools closed until March 30th. This weekwill be optional work days for staff. We are working non-stop to make this time as least disruptive as possible for our students and families.
Breakfast and lunch pickup meals are now available Monday through Friday for all students from 11am to 1pm at the three high school campuses. There is no charge for this service. Parents who can not travel to a food distribution site at one of our high schools should contact their child's school between 9am and 2pm so that we can gather information on the needs.
Make sure to check out the online resources we've posted on the district website.Students are encouraged to participate in online instruction whether assigned by teachers or normal resources they use during the school day. We are awaiting guidance from the Department of Public Instruction for future instructional requirements.
We continue to work with the NC Department of Public Instruction and will follow their guidance as more decisions are made for all public schools and in the meantime will do everything possible in the best interest of students, staff, and community members. We'll have daily updates available so that you have the most recent information available via phone call and of course, make sure to check the district website and Facebook/Twitter pages for additional information.
Familia de las Escuelas del Condado de Brunswick, aqu est la actualizacin del Lunes para las Escuelas del Condado de Brunswick. El Gobernador ha ordenado cerrar todas las escuelas hasta el 30 de Marzo. Estamos trabajando sin parar para hacer que este tiempo sea lo menos perturbador posible para nuestros estudiantes y familias.
Desayuno y almuerzo estn ahora disponibles para recoger de Lunes a Viernes para todos los estudiantes de 11 am a 1 pm en las tres instalaciones de escuela superior. No habr cargo por este servicio. Los padres que no puedan viajar hasta los centros de distribucin deben comunicarse con la escuela de su nio entre 9 am y 2 pm para recopilar informacin para lo que puedan necesitar.
Asegrese de verificar los recursos en lnea que hemos publicado en el sitio web del distrito. Exhortamos a los estudiantes a participar de la instruccin en lnea bien sea de lo asignado por los maestros o de los recursos normales que utilizan durante el da escolar. Estamos esperando guia del Departamento de Instruccin Pblica para requerimientos de instruccin futuros.
Continuaremos trabajando con el Departamento de Instruccin Pblica de Carolina del Norte y seguiremos su directriz a la vez que ms decisiones son tomadas para todas las escuelas pblicas y mientras tanto haremos todo lo posible en el mejor inters de los estudiantes, el personal, y miembros de la comunidad, asegrese de verificar el sitio web del distrito y las pginas de Facebook/Twitter para informacin adicional.

3/15/2020 UPDATE:In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until March 30th, 2020.Monday is an optional workday for staff.Las escuelas del condado de Brunswick estn cerradas hasta el 30 de marzo.

CHILD NUTRITION: Brunswick County Schools will be providing pickup meals for all children 1-18 years of age. The district will be providing breakfast and lunch meals at NBHS, SBHS WBHS for pickup from 11-1:00 pm. The district will be providing these meals Monday thru Friday during the school closure.
NBHS:114 Scorpion Drive Leland, NC 28451
WBHS:550 Whiteville Road Shallotte, NC 28470

SBHS:280 Cougar Drive, BSL Southport, NC 28461
Parents can pickup meals by coming to one of the sites listed. We ask that Parents stay in their car and packaged breakfast and lunch meals will be brought out to them. There will be no charge to our families with children from the age of 1-18 years old.
Las comidas para llevar a casa para todos los estudiantes estn disponibles para que las
recojan en nuestras escuelas secundarias de lunes a viernes de 11 a.m. a 1 p.m.
Escuela secundaria del sur de Brunswick. West Brunswick High School.
Escuela secundaria del norte de Brunswick

Monday from 11-4pm, Parents will also be allowed to check out tech devices if they do not have them at home for their children. Numerous online resources and video tutorials on how to access them are now available on the district website under 'District News'. Make sure to reach out to your cell and or internet provider to see if they are offering help during this time. Most companies have mentioned some kind of help.

We continue to work with the NC Department of Public Instruction and will follow their guidance as more decisions are made for all public schools and in the meantime will do everything possible in the best interest of students, staff, and community members.

div.p: More updates to come, and of course, make sure to check the district website and Facebook/Twitter pages for additional information.

div.span: 3/14/2020 UPDATE: In following the guidance of North Carolina Governor Roy Cooper, Brunswick County Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16th, until March 30th, 2020.
Monday, March 16th will be an optional workday for staff.
We will have more information for students, parents, staff and community members as soon as possible.
This is an evolving situation and we are dedicated to making sure students remain healthy and engaged during this time frame.

p.span: As concerns over Coronavirus (COVID-19) continue to increase, please be assured that student and staff safety and protection is of utmost concern to the Brunswick County Board of Education. We are taking proactive measures to prevent the spread of this and any other communicable disease. However, we continue to follow the lead of our state and local public health professionals as we continue to provide a healthy environment in which our students can learn.

We have been in contact with local, state and federal officials and our actions have been based on what we have received from these officials. We have concluded that it is in the best interests of our students that we will cancel all out of county field trips and activities. The North Carolina High School Athletic Association (NCHSAA) has suspended all athletic events from 11:59pm March 13, until April 6, 2020. Additionally, we have decided to include our middle school athletics in this athletic suspension. This includes all workouts, skill development, practices and contests. Lastly, we are asking for our school volunteers to suspend their efforts for the next two weeks.

We continue to encourage our students and staff to take preventative measures as well. Utilize social distancing techniques whenever possible; wash your hands regularly; clean and disinfect objects and surfaces that are frequently touched; cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue; and avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth. For our staff members, if you have traveled out of the country recently, we expect you to follow the recommendation from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) to self quarantine for the next 14 days.
-Dr. Jerry L. Oates, Superintendent of Schools

div.p: Thisis an evolving situation and we will adjust accordingly but we want you to have the most recent information available. Here are the current impacts involving Brunswick County Schools effective March 16-April 6:

SCHOOL SANITATION: Brunswick County Schools continues to be proactive in making sure all schools maintain routine sanitation. Beginning Monday, March 16th, BCS Operations will begin utilizing electrostatic foggers in all schools to disinfect the buildings. The disinfectant detergent and
deodorant is effective against a large number of bacteria and viruses, including coronavirus. The cleaning will take place routinely and after school hours while after school events are postponed/canceled.

ALL SCHOOLS: Schools are currently operating on normal schedules. Students and staff should stay home if they have a fever, used fever-reducing medication, or experienced symptoms of illness within the past 24 hours. Parents/Guardians need to provide a note to their child's school if they are going to be absent. You can view the CDC's Considerations for School Closures process by clicking HERE.

CANCELED OR POSTPONEDEVENTS:Please click HERE for a list of current events that have been canceled or postponed from March 16-April 6, 2020.This list will be updated as more information becomes available.
FIELD TRIPS:Allout of county field trips and activities have been canceled until April 6th.
PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT: All out of district professional development is canceleduntil April 6th.

AFTER SCHOOL ACTIVITIES: Beginning March 16th, 2020until April 6th, 2020, all after school activities at all schools are canceled. Please contact your individual school if you have a question regarding an event/activity. The High School Proms are located off campus and are voluntary for students to attend. As of right now, High School Proms will still take place.

ALL SPORTS:The NCHSAA Board of Directors has moved to suspend interscholastic athletics beginning at 11:59 p.m. on Friday, March 13, 2020 through Monday, April 6th, 2020. The NCHSAA Board of Directors will assess this situation regularly over the next few weeks. This includes all workouts, skill development, practices and contests.BrunswickCounty Schools will follow the same guidelines for our middle school athletics. All middle school athletics will be suspended beginningat 11:59 pm on Friday, March 13, 2020 through Monday, April 6, 2020. This includes all activitiesrelated to athletics including games, practice, training, conditioning, etc.
div.div: VOLUNTEERS/VISITORS:In order to protect our valued volunteers, many of whom fall into the at-risk category based on recommendations from the CDC, volunteer services are being suspended until April 6th, 2020. The only visitors allowed inside schools are parents/guardians who are checking in or out students or attending a scheduled meeting, until April 6th, 2020. We are grateful for the continued community support and understanding to ensure all students, staff, and community members are safe.

ECHS/BCC/CCP STUDENTS: TBCC will transition to online programming wherever possible beginning Saturday, March 14, 2020, through March 29, 2020. Workforce development courses and hands-on learning activities during this time period will be rescheduled at a later date. Computer labs will remain open on the main campus for students needing computer and Internet access. The Brunswick County Library System will be available for BCC students. All students should check their Moodle sites for additional information regarding their course(s). Updates:http://www.brunswickcc.edu/coronavirus

This information will be updated as new information becomes available. We will also share via our communication platforms that include phone calls, social media, emails and the local news media. You can opt in to district phone calls by calling855-502-7867.

div.p: We will continue to take every measure to ensure the health and safety of our students. If you have further questions or concerns about the Coronavirus (COVID-19), you can view the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention website athttps://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-nCoV/orNC Department of Health and Human Services website.
You can also view the measures the Brunswick County Health and Human Services Department have taken to address this issue athttps://www.brunswickcountync.gov/health/coronavirus/

Do you have a question regarding the Coronavirus? Brunswick County has opened a joint information center featuring a public health call line with county nurses available to answer questions and provide information to residents about the novel coronavirus. The phone line will be available Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. until further notice.
The County also has an email account where residents can send in their questions via email. Emails sent over the weekend will be answered on the next business day.
div.h6: Brunswick County Public Health Call Line and Email Information
div.p: 24/7 HELPLINE: The NC Division of Public Health has a statewide helpline staffed 24 hours a day, 7 days a week with a variety of experts who can assist you(1-866-462-3821).
Address 35 Referendum Drive NE, Bolivia, NC 28422
